headline: White House Refuses to Release 20 Emails About Ukraine Aid Freeze
abstract: It contends the release of the documents sought by The Times would “inhibit the frank and candid exchange of views” in government decision-making.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration disclosed on Friday that there were 20 emails between a top aide to President Trump’s acting chief of staff and a colleague at the White House’s Office of Management and Budget discussing the freeze of a congressionally mandated military aid package for Ukraine.
keywords: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry
